name: Congenital Erythropoietic Porphyria (Günther Disease)
chief_complaint: My child's skin blisters easily in sunlight, and their urine is dark red
physical_findings: Fragile blistering skin in sun-exposed areas
treatment: Strict sunlight avoidance and protective clothing
High-level UV protection (tinted windows, special lighting)
Hematopoietic stem cell transplantation in severe cases
Red blood cell transfusions for symptomatic anemia
prognosis: Chronic condition with variable severity; severe cases have reduced life expectancy due to complications; early diagnosis and strict photoprotection improve quality of life
description: An extremely rare autosomal recessive metabolic disorder affecting heme biosynthesis, characterized by accumulation of uroporphyrin I in bones, teeth, and tissues. Causes cutaneous photosensitivity, hemolytic anemia, and progressive mutilating photodermatosis. Onset typically occurs in infancy or early childhood.
